Blog.post: So I've just spent the last hour browsing Amazon.com. Damn you! You are too good! I have settled on 5 choices: 1) Melon Collie and the Infinite Sadness By Smashing Pumpkins Double disc set. Was stolen from me quite a few years back. I miss them! 2) Franz Ferdinand By Franz Ferdinand You may have seen their "Take Me Out" Video on MTV. What a rockin' tune. Must have. 3) Schmack! By Steriogram These kids are my age and younger. I just need to have them in my collection. What promise they have! (P.S. They have a video made almost entirely of yarn.... ponder that) 4) Stellastarr* By Stellastarr* These guys are too cool. My Coco has definitely hit on my TRL chart. They sound a little like Billy Idol (Dancin' with Myself) & the Smiths. I know that sounds odd - but that's what it sounds like!) 5) Good News... By Modest Mouse "Float On" easily makes it into my top 10 of the month. I know some of you think I have odd taste in music. I have attached some of their websites so that you can check it out for yourself. These are all edgy, indie punk style bands. If you like the Backstreet Boys, you need not go in. Happy Listening! www.steriogram.com www.modestmouse.com www.franzferdinand.co.uk www.stellastarr.com

Well, Jesper was taken away today. Apparently the lady down the street had called the Animal Shelter before she found out I was keeping it, and someone had been there looking for this particular kitty. So the crazy lady came and started wigging out in my yard because she missed her kitty so bad. Jesper was hesitant to go, but if it was her kitty, then she needed to take him... Guess what his real name was... Charlie Tuna. That lady was a freak. I will miss you Jesper.. you will alway be remembered on my blog!!! :( (I'm crying)
urlLink ....yawn... Good morning, Wilson.... Wilson? Wilson? WILLLLLLLLLSSSSSOOOOOOOONNNNNN!!!! urlLink
urlLink I'm getting pretty tired, Wilson... maybe I will just take a nap...you won't mind, right Wilson? urlLink
urlLink Oh Wilson, I love you. I'm going to hold onto you forever... urlLink
urlLink Kitty's claws are digging into Tim's legs... note the expression... urlLink
urlLink An up close and personal encounter between Pup and Kitty. A few moments after this photo, Pup's ass was kicked by what I can only assume to be Puss N Boot's cousin... urlLink
urlLink Where's Kitty? urlLink

urlLink Please respond to the following: and be nice! i ____ nikki. nikki is ____. if i were alone in a room with nikki, i would _______. i think nikki should _____. nikki needs ______. i want to ____________ nikki. someday nikki will ________. nikki reminds me of _______. without nikki _______. memories of nikki are ________. nikki can be __________. __________ is how i describe meeting nikki. worst thing about nikki is _________. best thing about nikki is _________. i am ________ with nikki. if i could say one thing to nikki it would be _________. nikki says _________ alot. urlLink

I just got back from seeing Shrek 2. What a cute little film. The best part of it has got to be "Puss NBoots", voiced by Antonio Banderas... Here kitty, kitty. I just can't see many more of these though... I hear they are making a 3 and 4?? Too much Shrek!

urlLink Today is the best day ever. All of the 80's movies are on TV. Molly Ringwold, I never quite got what it was about her (maybe I'm the wrong sex to get it). But more power to her... where is she now?And can someone please bring back Jake from Sixteen Candles. He's in hiding somewhere making furniture. He was soooo hot! urlLink

urlLink I have to give another Hello to my old Roomie and good friend Ashleigh J (now Ashleigh J Lake) who's now a NEW mommy! Congratulations girl! I have all the blackmail pictures from the old days! I will post our trip to Vegas, baby, Vegas on here soon!! urlLink
urlLink This is Tim in Key West, FL. This is right across the street from where we stayed on Marathon. We definitely were wastin' away in Margaritaville. urlLink

urlLink I have to give a shout out to my girl Alaina. She is one of my best friends in the whole wide world! She and I have caused sooo much drama in our life, and we loved every minute of it! urlLink
urlLink Me and the girls aboard the Carnival Cruise.. we apparently drank all of the alcohol. From left to right: Samatha, Wendy, and Kim. Oh yeah, that's me in the back! urlLink
urlLink As a patron of the All You Can Drink Rum Cruise, it is customary for the captain of the boat to stop driving all together and join in on the excitement... urlLink
urlLink Here I am on the "All you can drink rum cruise" outside of Nassau. Man, those were the days... urlLink

urlLink Once upon a time there was a young girl named Nikki who went on a cruise to the Bahamas. For 4 days and nights she did nothing but drink. She had no sleep, lots of food, and lots of booze. Here is a shot of us posing for a Carnival Cruise Brochure... I sware we will be on there one day! From left to right: Money Bags (claims to live next to Martha Stewart), Samatha, Tony (favorite part of the trip), Nikki and Wendy. urlLink

urlLink When I moved into a house I actually owned, I decided it was time for me to learn how to garden and landscape. Now, I am no professional, but please look at this LOVELY gardenia! They're ALIVE!! urlLink

urlLink Hi. My name is Bailey. I want to apologize for all of my photos throughout this thing. I am my mother's only child (despite what she thinks) and therefore she snaps photos of me like it is the last time she'll ever see me. I mean, I know I'm cute and all, but geez, mom, give it a rest. Can't you see I'm trying to sleep here, and I open my eye- and there you are with a flipping camera! Argh! urlLink
urlLink For those of you who have never been here... this is the view (after walking 2 minutes) from my house on beautiful Lake Martin, Alabama. I encourage everyone to make it here one day! urlLink

urlLink This is my cousin Eric, my Uncle Howie and Eric's 2 sons, Avery and Chandler. What little heart breakers!!! I'm a little lopsided in this photo, they snapped it when Chandler was standing on my foot. This was taken out front of East 74 Restaurant in Charlotte. They have the BEST GYROS ever!!! urlLink
urlLink The BLUE eye.. natural light. urlLink
urlLink There isn't anything cuter than little boys... my cousin urlLink
urlLink And the clearest eyeof them all! urlLink
urlLink This is my eye. I had just gotten my digital camera and was fooling around..freaky freaky urlLink

urlLink This is my pup in the morning doing the infamous"death roll". If you are laying down, she will lay on top of your neck and begin flipping around like an alligator does with their prey.... urlLink

urlLink This picture kind of reminds me of the Great Gatsby, because they always talk about the billboard with the set of eyes watching over the city... and Jesper outside the window is just taunting my darling Bailey.. if only she'd show the rest of her, not just her eyes! urlLink

So I saw Troy today. I was looking so forward to it. Not for the dumbed down version of the Iliad, because it didn't really stick to the story. I was looking forward to it because I am like every other woman in America - Extremely Hot for Brad Pitt. Although, to me, the real hottie of this film had to be Hector, played by Eric Bana (Hoot off of Black Hawk Down). The movie wasn't exceptional by any means. Actually for the first hour I thought I was watching a made for TV movie. If you compared it to Gladiator, which I thoroughly enjoyed, it would be a B movie in comparison... that is until you get to the scene before Hector and Achilles fight. And for a good 30 minutes there, its actually a pretty good flick. But other than that, I think those actors can act a lot better than they actually did. It just seemed way to showy, and not enough depth. The one person you actually want to die doesn't die (other than Agamemnon). Basically this story says, go- be a coward, and sleep with married women... you'll live longer
urlLink Another one of my watercolor on canvas using a Qtip. This was inspired by a real skyline seen in Clanton, AL. urlLink
urlLink Boats. Done with exterior house paint on wood. Also used the biggest P.O.S. brush I could possibly find. I like all the shapes. urlLink
urlLink My very first painting ever. I had a thing for purple. And guys made of stone.Hmmm. urlLink

urlLink My first mixed media. Watercolor and pen and ink. The signature is from Brandon Slay, Olympic Gold Medalist in Wrestling down in Sydney. He was from Dallas, and when I lived there, he signed it for me. urlLink
urlLink One of my earlier attempts at painting. Watercolor, black only. "Pig and Bunny" urlLink
urlLink Another busy roadway... urlLink
urlLink Why not Ristorante?!? I learned it in my book! I didn't travel overseas to go to a place named RESTAURANT!!! urlLink

urlLink So, Peggy Guggenheim lived to be 94... however, according to the engraved stone to the right, none of her 14 children lived to be over 20 years of age, most in the single digits. An interesting observation. urlLink
urlLink Row, row, row your boat. urlLink
urlLink In the square, this building looms overhead while Tippi Heddren is attacked by several... just kidding. I fed the birds. They had reason to attack. urlLink
urlLink One of the most natural shots in all of Venice. I took this when I was in a water taxi, so it gave me a really nice angle to get the gondolas with. urlLink
urlLink One to many at ole' Harry's. For the boys who are interested, on the other side of the guy behind me, there were 2 Playboy Playmates. Crazy. urlLink
urlLink Many a thing can be said for those who travel to foreign countries, only to end up in a bar named after an American. Oh Harry, we salute you! urlLink
urlLink A canal at sunset on the island of Murano or Burano, i forget which. One makes lace, the other glass. This is the one that makes lace. urlLink
urlLink Hotel Excelsior on the island of Lido in Venice Italy. We were one week shy of the Venice Film Festival... why, God, why!?!?!?! urlLink
urlLink I am Bailey, queen of the sniffers! urlLink
urlLink My piggy bank of champions, feed me, says the piggy. urlLink
urlLink Stop staring at me, swan! urlLink
urlLink My name is Jesper. You killed my father. Prepare to die. urlLink

urlLink Dad (JoeJoe) and me. Awwww urlLink
urlLink This is me on my wedding day! March 17, 2001. urlLink
urlLink As you may have noticed, I kind of have a thing for John Cusack. And yes, my husband knows. Oh John, I love you! urlLink
urlLink My, how tasty a Jesper kitty would be right about now. So soft, so pretty, so easy for me ... to poop on! urlLink
urlLink This is "Mr. Bojangles", my sister abandoned him, as she does with all of her animals after they grow up. urlLink
urlLink The new and improved Meowing Kitty. urlLink
urlLink Bailey, the first born. My angel! urlLink

It has become clear to me that I must have been Cinderella or Dr. Dolittle in a former life. I can not seem to have only 1 pet. I have recently become a foster parent to one Mr. Bojangles, a Beta fish with quite an attitude. Also, I am now an adoptive parent to a very demure yet spunky Jesper (pronounced Yes-Purr, like Jesper Parnevik the golfer)the stray kitty that has made a permanent residence. And of course, our first born, Bailey Irish Queen -- who, by the way, doesn't quite know what to think of all of these other animals intruding on her territory. (She should just be thankful there are no mice)
urlLink This is me in the "Rumble Seat". That was a real bitch to get into, and even more of a bitch to get out of! FINE CAR!! urlLink

urlLink This is me welcoming my car in. This car is owned by Bill France, who's father founded NASCAR (Alaina, eat your heart out!) The car is an exact replica of the one that was the original racer in the very first NASCAR race!! The navigator and driver both work for NASCAR in Daytona, and they hooked us up with cool info! urlLink
urlLink this is the one I call "Silver Bullet". No ladies,not that kind! It was fabulous! urlLink
urlLink This FINE Bentley rolled in... my jaw dropped of course. Oh Ben Affleck, won't you buy ME one???? urlLink

urlLink And so the Great Race begins... Well, we were a pit stop really. The annual great race features antique cars that drive from Point A to Point B across the USA in 2 weeks. You can check out more info by logging on to www.greatrace.com I was one of the sponsors/greeters, so I will post a few pics of the AWESOME cars that cruised into OUR town! urlLink
urlLink My Morning Jacket rockin' the house. They look like metal - but they rock! urlLink
urlLink Random shot of the City Stages crowd (behind us!) urlLink

urlLink Alaina & I at this year's City Stages 2004 in Birmingham, AL... Cool acts like Stellastarr*, My Morning Jacket, Chris Robinson, Lynard Skynard, KID ROCK, Kanye West, Switchfoot, Los Lonely Boys, etc... It rocked! urlLink
urlLink Chris Robinson (formerly of the Black Crowes -pre-Yoko Hudson breaking up the band). His new sound is very cool, very weed-induced. He still sounds awesome! urlLink

urlLink Our first look at the new Chris Robinson & (get this) the New Earth Mud. Hmmm. Not sure how he could get away with that, but after the show I realized how. Gotta love the rockin' hippies! urlLink
urlLink Shawn Christensen (lead singer) of Stellastarr*. RUN, do not WALK, to go buy this KICKASS album!! What a great show!! urlLink
urlLink This my friends, is the rockin' band Stellastarr* They played one HELL of a show! I must say though, people didn't rock out like the should have... I LOVE YOU LEAD SINGER!! urlLink
urlLink This is a picture of Children's Harbor on Lake Martin. It is on the way to the Amphitheatre. Home of Alex City Jazz Fest! urlLink
urlLink This is a picture of Children urlLink

urlLink This is a picture of the Lake Martin Amphitheatre before everyone (the crowd)got there. It overlooks Lake Martin (background). The tour buses belong to Dickey Betts of the Allman Brothers and Los Lonely Boys. urlLink
urlLink Everybody needs a bosom for a pillow, everybody needs a bosom! urlLink

urlLink man i'm cute! urlLink

urlLink bailey & newby during playtime. turns out i'm probably allergic to kitty. i haven't stopped sneezing, watery eyes, itchy face since she came home. I've always had outside kitties. this is my first indoor! if anyone would like a precious kitty, let me know! urlLink
urlLink I am still the favorite. Don't let these kitties fool you! urlLink
urlLink This is Newby and Bailey, trying to get along. urlLink

urlLink Hello! I'm Newby - the newest member of the Reeves family. I was adopted today from the Animal Shelter. I have white paws and belly, and the rest of me is black, except for my chin and 1/2 of my top lip(as you can see!) My new sister Bailey keeps trying to "nip" me. If you ask me, she's a little crazy. But I just sit there and let her do it, because I'm only 6 weeks old. Bailey asked me if I did drugs too (bc she takes herbs everyday) and I said I brought my own. Got a dime bag of cat nip in my new room. Man, my mom's so cool... urlLink
urlLink Alright I know I said I wasn't posting the picture of her in a dress, but look how BEAUTIFUL!! She needs to lose about 10 inches in height though, AMAZON woman! urlLink

urlLink This shot, is a) SO COOL. b) SO FREAKING COOL. c) ROCKS THE CASBAH. I mean, how often do you see a light, with LITE around it.. very cool shot. I have no idea who took this photo, but I assume it was taken at the Garage. urlLink
urlLink My best friend Josh... SO CUTE!! Ladies, I'm his personal PR Rep. Just ask him :) Whoa... we TOTALLY have the same eyeballs in this picture. Man, I was drunk. urlLink
urlLink In this picture, one of my best friends is TOTALLY checking out my boobs. Yes, they are nice, aren't they? urlLink
urlLink this is what the night looked like to me... blurry! urlLink

urlLink This is Shannon, her boyfriend Matt, and I at the Garage in downtown Mobile on Saturday night. Fox did well for herself, I LOVE that guy! urlLink

urlLink This weekend was a hoot! Here is Sat. July 3. Randi went bridal gown shopping and took Alaina and I for moral support and bridesmaid dress shopping. I am afraid of putting gown pictures on here of her bc I'm not sure which one she's going to use...so this head shot of miss pretty princess will have to do! urlLink

urlLink This weekend was a hoot... here is Saturday, July 3. Randi went bridal gown shopping and took Alaina and I with her to search for bridesmaids dresses... I am not going to post any dress pictures of Randi, bc that's bad luck! But here is the bride to be! urlLink

urlLink Brad Cotter, how I love thee! Let me count the ways.... This is Brad Cotter and I (this past year's Nashville Star winner) when he was doing a closed press conference on Lake Martin. We were inside Hank Williams cabin. Oh Brad! urlLink

I am not one for pushing my beliefs on anyone, nor do I intend to here. Those who know me, will know that I try to be as open-minded as possible. The following is an excerpt from a website that I have found, that pretty much sums up how I feel about what is going on right now in the Middle East. If you feel the same, please feel free to visit the website also, and take a look around. If you do not, well, I respect your opinion, and hope that you will do the same for me. I don't agree with everything on the site, but I do agree with the Pledge of Resistance. I do not want to live my life in fear. I am not against the Soldiers, I'm against the War. We believe that as people living in the United States it is our responsibility to resist the injustices done by our government, in our names Not in our name will you wage endless war there can be no more deaths no more transfusions of blood for oil Not in our name will you invade countries bomb civilians, kill more children letting history take its course over the graves of the nameless Not in our name will you erode the very freedoms you have claimed to fight for Not by our hands will we supply weapons and funding for the annihilation of families on foreign soil Not by our mouths will we let fear silence us Not by our hearts will we allow whole peoples or countries to be deemed evil Not by our will and Not in our name We pledge resistance We pledge alliance with those who have come under attack for voicing opposition to the war or for their religion or ethnicity We pledge to make common cause with the people of the world to bring about justice,freedom and peace Another world is possible and we pledge to make it real. urlLink http://www.notinourname.net/index.html
